render.tex: %text \textcolor{blue}{\text{Recognizing the type}} Is it an ordinary differential eqn.? Is it homogenous or linear? %

reason.tex:
%text At school level, you will be asked to solve only the following types of differential equations % \begin{align} \frac{dy}{dx} &= f(x,y) = g(x)\cdot h(y) \\ \frac{dy}{dx} &= f(x,y) = g\left(\frac{y}{x}\right) \text{ (homogenous)} \\ \frac{dy}{dx} + Py &= Q \text{ (first-order linear) } \end{align}
%text
Notice that all of the above equations have \underline\text{order one and degree one}.
Only when you know the type of the equation can you pick the correct technique for solving it. %
